summary: This is an FBI internal planning document outlining the operational approach for CID Branch I, which oversees investigations into major criminal violations including Violent Crimes Against Children. It describes lines of effort for technology planning, threat prioritization, operations-intelligence integration, and resource alignment across 56 field offices.
keyFacts: FBI CID Branch I oversees investigations into five major criminal violations: Violent Crime, Gangs, Transnational Organized Crime (x2), and Violent Crimes Against Children.
The branch coordinates investigative activities across 4 sections and 56 field offices.
The operational approach focuses on four lines of effort: Technology Planning & Integration, Threat Prioritization & Guidance, Operations-Intelligence Integration, and Resource Alignment.
The document emphasizes maximizing investigative creativity in field offices while focusing efforts to achieve FBI, DOJ, national, and international threat-based objectives.
CID Branch I serves as the coordinating unit for technology needs analysis, identification, acquisition, and field integration for criminal investigations.
